intro: Corysanthes adunca, commonly known as the narrow-leaved corysanthes, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of northeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Corysanthes adunca is well adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
